title: The House of Wisdom: Baghdad's Think Tank
description: A quick win: understand The House of Wisdom: Baghdad's Think Tank.

hook.text: While Europe burned books, Baghdad collected them. The House of Wisdom was the world's greatest library.

buildup.text: Founded around 830 CE under Caliph al-Ma'mun, the House of Wisdom translated Greek, Persian, and Indian texts.

discovery.text: Scholars of all faiths â€” Muslim, Christian, Jewish â€” worked together. Knowledge had no religious border here.

twist.text: Without Baghdad's translators, Aristotle and Plato might have been lost. Europe later recovered them from Arabic.

climax.text: The House of Wisdom proves that diversity drives innovation. The Golden Age flourished because inclusion was policy.

punchline.text: Baghdad saved Aristotle. Europe got Greek philosophy back through Arabic.
